headline: Stocks to Watch Monday Recap: Kenvue, IREN, Berkshire, Amazon
summary: ↗️ Kenvue (KVUE): Shares of the Tylenol maker jumped 12% on the news that Kimberly-Clark (KMB) would purchase the company. Shares in the Huggies maker skidded, falling nearly 15%. ↗️ Amazon.com (AMZN): OpenAI agreed to pay $38 billion for computing power in a multiyear deal that marks the first partnership between the startup and the cloud giant.

content.title: Stocks to Watch Monday Recap: Kenvue, IREN, Berkshire, Amazon
content.summary: ↗️ Kenvue (KVUE): Shares of the Tylenol maker jumped 12% on the news that Kimberly-Clark (KMB) would purchase the company. Shares in the Huggies maker skidded, falling nearly 15%. ↗️ Amazon.com (AMZN): OpenAI agreed to pay $38 billion for computing power in a multiyear deal that marks the first partnership between the startup and the cloud giant.

headline: IREN shares surge after $9.7 billion AI cloud deal with Microsoft
summary: Investing.com -- Shares of IREN Limited have jumped more than 24 percent premarket on Monday after the company announced a multiyear GPU cloud services agreement with Microsoft valued at about $9.7 billion.

headline: IREN Soars 30% After Inking $9.7B AI Cloud Deal With Tech Giant Microsoft
summary: The deal is indicative of how miners’ once-volatile hardware fleets are increasingly viewed as strategic compute assets, bridging the gap between blockchain and AI.

content.summary: The deal is indicative of how miners’ once-volatile hardware fleets are increasingly viewed as strategic compute assets, bridging the gap between blockchain and AI.

headline: Microsoft signs $9.7 billion cloud deal with IREN as AI demand swells
summary: The news sent shares of IREN up as much as 24.7% to a record high on Monday, ‌with the stock last up nearly 10%.  AI-server maker Dell was also up about 1%, as it would provide IREN with Nvidia's GB300 chips and other equipment that Microsoft will use for about $5.8 billion.  The five-year Microsoft deal shows the AI industry's growing hunger for ⁠computing power to run applications such ‌as ChatGPT.

content.title: Microsoft signs $9.7 billion cloud deal with IREN as AI demand swells
content.summary: The news sent shares of IREN up as much as 24.7% to a record high on Monday, ‌with the stock last up nearly 10%.  AI-server maker Dell was also up about 1%, as it would provide IREN with Nvidia's GB300 chips and other equipment that Microsoft will use for about $5.8 billion.  The five-year Microsoft deal shows the AI industry's growing hunger for ⁠computing power to run applications such ‌as ChatGPT.
